message:
For Linux geeks:
I saw people here (especially Islam Gad) talking about Elementary linux distro

So I checked it out and it's amazing...

I'm not really a linux expert but I'm trying to get used to Ubuntu and when I read about Elementary they said it's based on Ubuntu

so can you please tell me what it's pros and cons ?

Is it ready to be used on daily basis to do heavy work

Is Freya stable enough or what exactly ? I just want to know what do you think about it overall

Thanks a lot

And in case some of you doesn't know about it here's a video:
story: Muhammad Saleh shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: elementary OS Freya Review - Linux Distro Reviews
caption: youtube.com
description: ==So...elementary OS Freya. What do you think about it? Revolutionary or incremental?== I take out the stops and review the latest elementary OS release 0.3 ...

data.message:
I can't confirm Freya stability as i didn't install it i only tried it once and it was beta before the release.
But i really can confirm luna's version stability its already installed on my heavy daily working machine.

Luna is , Stable, Clean, Simple, and as u said its based on ubuntu so there's no worry about community if there's any problem search for this problem in ubuntu community u will find a lot of solutions that will  solve your problem.
Screen shot of my current Desktop just showing how simple and clean this os.

Did you try KDE? How do you think it compares to Elementary?
I'm running Kubuntu with KDE Plasma 5.3 but it's too heavy on my current system..I think Elementary is lighter.
Islam Gad

Hostilely i didn't try Kubuntu i only tried ubuntu, mint, deepin and i stayed with elementary.
elementary is not heavy at all on my "Decent Machine",
dell 3542 Intel Core i7 4510U 4gp ram and its not a wow resources as u can see even the i7 is not the best out there its a dual core and still can handle my daily heavy work on PHP development sometimes i end up working with 5+ heavy applications working together at the same time and with out any problems.
Chrome, PHPstorm, MYSQL workbench, SmartGit, + some music ;)

I've Core2Duo E7500 and 4GB Ram.
I'll give it a shot.

Looks amazing I will try dual boot first then if I liked it I will make it my main one
Thanks a lot ;)

Yes it's amazing.. and also it's based on Ubuntu which is great as well
My only concern is that sometimes heavy customization breaks stuff
Mohamed A. Abdallah You missed this post i guess ! :)
Islam Gad How did you change the icons pack ?

Was really simple i installed something called elementary tweaks that enables me to change the icons pack and change the dock theme (dock is called Plank in elementary.) then after installing tweaks i installed  numix-icon-theme-circle and changed the icons set from elementary tweaks.
Any way to set "Switch keyboard layout" to "Alt+Shift" guys?
